citations.narrative:
Multiple gaps, approximately five of them, were observed below the perimeter fence of the giraffe, sheep, goats,
capybara, and kangaroos. The size of the perimeter fence deficiencies ranged from 5 to 11 inches in distance below the
fence (measured from the ground to the bottom wire of the fence) including at a drainage culvert and were up to
maximum length of approximately 3 feet of the perimeter fence.
The lack of an adequate perimeter fence presents a safety risk to the animals within the facility since it not only has to be
an adequate secondary containment system to hold animals that may escape their primary enclosures, but it should also
provide a sufficient barrier to keep out unauthorized animals and persons. The gaps below the perimeter fence could
allow some animal species to gain access to the animals.
The facility must ensure that the animals listed above are enclosed by an adequate perimeter fence that does not allow
unauthorized animals to crawl under it while maintaining a height of 6-feet and at least three feet in distance from the
primary enclosures or shall obtain a variance from the regional office. Correct by October 1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Lisa Ekman, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
